concept.title: Attributes
concept.shortdesc: Attributes in TokenScript define the properties of a token.

conbody.p: In TokenScript you declare “attributes”. These are properties of the token. For example, if a token represents a ticket for a soccer match, its attributes should contain the information when and where the match happens, which teams play, which seat is reserved and so on. If the token allows you to lease a car, it needs an attribute like “expiry”.
Attributes can be nested and contain subcategories. The declaration “label” translates information to different languages.

Attributes are just declarations. They are never directly shown to a wallet. They are just here to let the wallet know and to allow TokenScript to build further operations and representations on it. To make them visible you need cards.
Attribute is a categorical declaration. There are other declarations inside the <attribute> tags, for example <origins> or <token>.
If you TokenScript wants to querry an API for information, like weather or exchange prices, this will not be part of the attribute tag, but part of an action card.
